answers.answer: Newcomers can find information on managing in a new city, important contacts, support for accommodation, meals and integration, transportation, medical services, psychological support, education, and various organizations offering assistance.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The Immigration Service of Constanța county can be contacted at +40241 502 307 or +40241 611 364.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: The provided content states that information is required for the accommodation, board, and integration support program, but does not specify what that information is.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Constanța'.

answers.answer: To travel within Constanța city, one can use the bus and check the lines of interest via a provided link.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Transportation'.

answers.answer: Medical services are available at the Constanța Emergency County Clinical Hospital Sf Apostol Andrei, and a list of family doctors from Constanța county is also provided.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: Children can receive medical help at the Pediatric Clinical Department of the Sf Apostol Andrei County Emergency Clinical Hospital.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: Psychological support is offered by World Vision Romania, Terre des hommes Foundation, and The International Organization for Migration (IOM), including psychosocial support activities, specialized services, mental health awareness, and first aid.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: Psychological support is available in Russian, Ukrainian, Romanian, and English languages.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: The Constanța County School Inspectorate provides information on the enrollment of Ukrainian students in Romanian pre-university education units and details on specific documents are available via a link.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: Organizations offering support services in Constanța include CNRR (The Romanian National Council for Refugees), AIDRom, ROUA Center, Constanta Regional Integration Center (JRS Romania Association), The Sensiblu Foundation, and Novapolis Association.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: AIDRom offers social and legal advice and information, social assistance including vouchers for food, hygiene, and medicine, medical consultations, coverage of education system costs, labor market access support, and cultural integration.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The ROUA Center Constanța provides information and counselling services, legal, psychosocial, and economic assistance, Romanian language courses, and support for integration.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The provided content indicates a section for "Legal status" but does not offer any specific information or details regarding it.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The provided content indicates a section for "Housing Info" but does not offer any specific information or details regarding housing.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: AIDRom offers support in accessing the labor market as part of its services.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The Women's Center provides support in accessing reproductive health services, navigating the health system, and services dedicated to victims of domestic violence.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Women's Center'.

answers.answer: People living with HIV can receive free, anonymous, and confidential psycho-medical-social HIV services from specialist doctors at 10 Regional HIV Centers in Romania, along with the expertise and support of Sens Pozitiv.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Counseling for people living with HIV'.
